TextEquiv.Unicode: Et us call to our
Father in heaven
through our Lord
Jesus Christe,
that he wil vouch
safe to poure his
grace into us, that
we may to our no smal profit, dispatch
and expound the last part of the Arti
cles of Christian beliefe,
The ninth Article of faith is this,
The holie Catholidue Churth, the
communion of saintes. After the con
fession of our beleif in the holy Trini
tie, and in the mysterie of the Sonne
of God our Lord Jesus Christ, and
lastly in the holie Ghost the sanctifier
and restorer of all: nowe in the fourth
part is reckoned up the fruite and po
wer, the effect and ende of faith, and
what doth come to, and is bestowed on
the faithfull. There commeth to them
communion of God and all saintes,
sanetification remission of sinnes, the
resurrection of the fleshe and life e
verlasting. Of which I will speake
in order as they lye so far forth as the
bountifull Lord shall give me abilitie.
Nowe then here we have to rehearse
out of the eight Article this worde I
believe, we must(I meane) say, I be
lieve the holie Catholique Church.
Some unlearned there are which hold
opinion that in this point of our con
fession we should say, I believe in the
holy Church. The reason that leades
them so to thinke is this, because they
finde written in the Constantinopli
tane Creede, And in the holy Ghost the
worshipped and glorified, who spake
and Apostolique Church. For these
wordes they doe so distinguishe that
Lorde that giveth life, who proceedeth
from the father & the sonne who toge
ther with the father & the son is to bee
by the Prophetes in one Catholiqu,

Et us call to our Father in heaven through our Lord Jesus Christe, that he wil vouch safe to poure his grace into us, that we may to our no smal profit, dispatch and expound the last part of the Arti cles of Christian beliefe, The ninth Article of faith is this, The holie Catholidue Churth, the communion of saintes. After the con fession of our beleif in the holy Trini tie, and in the mysterie of the Sonne of God our Lord Jesus Christ, and lastly in the holie Ghost the sanctifier and restorer of all: nowe in the fourth part is reckoned up the fruite and po wer, the effect and ende of faith, and what doth come to, and is bestowed on the faithfull. There commeth to them communion of God and all saintes, sanetification remission of sinnes, the resurrection of the fleshe and life e verlasting. Of which I will speake in order as they lye so far forth as the bountifull Lord shall give me abilitie. Nowe then here we have to rehearse out of the eight Article this worde I believe, we must(I meane) say, I be lieve the holie Catholique Church. Some unlearned there are which hold opinion that in this point of our con fession we should say, I believe in the holy Church. The reason that leades them so to thinke is this, because they finde written in the Constantinopli tane Creede, And in the holy Ghost the worshipped and glorified, who spake and Apostolique Church. For these wordes they doe so distinguishe that Lorde that giveth life, who proceedeth from the father & the sonne who toge ther with the father & the son is to bee by the Prophetes in one Catholiqu,
as they doe repeate out of the premkts
ses these wordes, I believe, and make
this the sense, I believe in the holie
Ghost the Lorde : even so here againe
they doe repeate these wordes, I be
lieve, making this to be the sense, I
believe in one Catholique and Apo
stolique Church. But this is more
than needeth, yea and against all god
linesse doe they wrest these wordes
of the Creede. For this, In one Ca
tholique and Apostolique Church, is
not referred to the Verbe, I believe,
but to the holy Ghost, because hee
spake by the Prophetes in one Ca
tholique and Apostolique Church,
For our meaning is, and we confesse
that one and the same spirite did all
thinges in both Testamentes, contra
rie to the opinion of them which ima
gined that there were two spirits con
trarie one to the other
Moreover, Saint Cyprian in his
exposition of the Apostles Creede,
sayth: He sayd not in the holy churth,
nor in the remission of sinnes, nor
in the resurrection of the bodie. For
if hee had added the preposition, In,
then had the force of those clauses
beene all one with the force of that
that went before, For in those wordes
wherein our beliefe touthing the
Godhead is set downe we say, in God
the Father, In lesus Christ his Son, and
in the holy ghostibut in the rest where
the speach is not of the Godhead, but
touthing the creatures or mysteries,
the preposition In is not added, that
we may say in the holy Churth, but
that the holy Churth is to be beleeved
not as we beleve in God, but as a con
gregation gathered together to God,
and that the forgivenesse of sinnes is to
leeve in the forgivenesse of sinnes: and
that the resurreetion of the flesh is to
be beleeved, not that we ovoht to be

as they doe repeate out of the premkts ses these wordes, I believe, and make this the sense, I believe in the holie Ghost the Lorde : even so here againe they doe repeate these wordes, I be lieve, making this to be the sense, I believe in one Catholique and Apo stolique Church. But this is more than needeth, yea and against all god linesse doe they wrest these wordes of the Creede. For this, In one Ca tholique and Apostolique Church, is not referred to the Verbe, I believe, but to the holy Ghost, because hee spake by the Prophetes in one Ca tholique and Apostolique Church, For our meaning is, and we confesse that one and the same spirite did all thinges in both Testamentes, contra rie to the opinion of them which ima gined that there were two spirits con trarie one to the other Moreover, Saint Cyprian in his exposition of the Apostles Creede, sayth: He sayd not in the holy churth, nor in the remission of sinnes, nor in the resurrection of the bodie. For if hee had added the preposition, In, then had the force of those clauses beene all one with the force of that that went before, For in those wordes wherein our beliefe touthing the Godhead is set downe we say, in God the Father, In lesus Christ his Son, and in the holy ghostibut in the rest where the speach is not of the Godhead, but touthing the creatures or mysteries, the preposition In is not added, that we may say in the holy Churth, but that the holy Churth is to be beleeved not as we beleve in God, but as a con gregation gathered together to God, and that the forgivenesse of sinnes is to leeve in the forgivenesse of sinnes: and that the resurreetion of the flesh is to be beleeved, not that we ovoht to be
